meanings.definition: behaviors or attitudes characteristic of a snob
meanings.sent1: Her snobbisms were evident in the way she looked down on others.
meanings.sent2: The party was full of snobbisms, with people only talking about their expensive vacations.
meanings.sent3: His snobbisms were so extreme that he refused to eat at any restaurant that wasn't Michelin-starred.
meanings.sent4: The snobbisms of the elite were like a barrier, keeping others out of their exclusive circle.
meanings.sent5: The snobbisms of the upper class were as clear as the designer labels they wore.

meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but cringe at the snobbisms coming out of his mouth.
meanings.sent2: His snobbisms often made others feel inferior and unwelcome.
meanings.sent3: The snobbisms he uttered were so ridiculous that they made everyone burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her snobbisms were like daggers, cutting through the conversation with their arrogance.
meanings.sent5: The snobbisms he spouted were as distasteful as spoiled milk.
